intro: Silene conica var. gavarniensis, commonly known as the Gavarnie bellflower, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the Pyrenees Mountains in France. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is adapted to rocky, high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils. Its conservation status is vulnerable due to habitat loss and limited distribution. This species is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
